verses.text: Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the wicked,
But his delight is in the law of Jehovah;
And he shall be like a tree planted by the streams of water,
The wicked are not so,
Therefore the wicked shall not stand in the judgment,
For Jehovah knoweth the way of the righteous;
Why do the nations rage,
The kings of the earth set themselves,
Let us break their bonds asunder,
He that sitteth in the heavens will laugh:
Then will he speak unto them in his wrath,
Yet I have set my king
I will tell of the decree:
Ask of me, and I will give thee the nations for thine inheritance,
Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron;
Now therefore be wise, O ye kings:
Serve Jehovah with fear,
Kiss the son, lest he be angry, and ye perish in the way,
Jehovah, how are mine adversaries increased!
Many there are that say of my soul,
But thou, O Jehovah, art a shield about me;
I cry unto Jehovah with my voice,
I laid me down and slept;
I will not be afraid of ten thousands of the people
Arise, O Jehovah; save me, O my God:
Salvation belongeth unto Jehovah:
Answer me when I call, O God of my righteousness;
O ye sons of men, how long shall my glory be turned into dishonor?
But know that Jehovah hath set apart for himself him that is godly:
Stand in awe, and sin not:
Offer the sacrifices of righteousness,
Many there are that say, Who will show us any good?
Thou hast put gladness in my heart,
In peace will I both lay me down and sleep;
Give ear to my words, O Jehovah,
Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God;
O Jehovah, in the morning shalt thou hear my voice;
For thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness:
The arrogant shall not stand in thy sight:
Thou wilt destroy them that speak lies:
But as for me, in the abundance of thy lovingkindness will I come into thy house:
Lead me, O Jehovah, in thy righteousness because of mine enemies;
For there is no faithfulness in their mouth;
Hold them guilty, O God;
But let all those that take refuge in thee rejoice,
For thou wilt bless the righteous;
O Jehovah, rebuke me not in thine anger,
Have mercy upon me, O Jehovah; for I am withered away:
My soul also is sore troubled:
Return, O Jehovah, deliver my soul:
For in death there is no remembrance of thee:
I am weary with my groaning;
Mine eye wasteth away because of grief;
Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity;
Jehovah hath heard my supplication;
All mine enemies shall be put to shame and sore troubled:
O Jehovah my God, in thee do I take refuge:
Lest they tear my soul like a lion,
O Jehovah my God, if I have done this;
If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me
Let the enemy pursue my soul, and overtake it;
Arise, O Jehovah, in thine anger;
And let the congregation of the peoples compass thee about;
Jehovah ministereth judgment to the peoples:
Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end, but establish thou the righteous:
My shield is with God,
God is a righteous judge,
If a man turn not, he will whet his sword;
He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death;
Behold, he travaileth with iniquity;
He hath made a pit, and digged it,
His mischief shall return upon his own head,
I will give thanks unto Jehovah according to his righteousness,
O Jehovah, our Lord,
Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou established strength,
When I consider thy heavens, the work of thy fingers,
What is man, that thou art mindful of him?
For thou hast made him but little lower than God,
Thou makest him to have dominion over the works of thy hands;
All sheep and oxen,
The birds of the heavens, and the fish of the sea,
O Jehovah, our Lord,
I will give thanks unto Jehovah with my whole heart;
I will be glad and exult in thee;
When mine enemies turn back,
For thou hast maintained my right and my cause;
Thou hast rebuked the nations, thou hast destroyed the wicked;
The enemy are come to an end, they are desolate for ever;
But Jehovah sitteth as king for ever:
And he will judge the world in righteousness,
Jehovah also will be a high tower for the oppressed,
And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee;
Sing praises to Jehovah, who dwelleth in Zion:
For he that maketh inquisition for blood remembereth them;
Have mercy upon me, O Jehovah;
That I may show forth all thy praise.
The nations are sunk down in the pit that they made:
Jehovah hath made himself known, he hath executed judgment:
The wicked shall be turned back unto Sheol,
For the needy shall not alway be forgotten,
Arise, O Jehovah; let not man prevail:
Put them in fear, O Jehovah:
Why standest thou afar off, O Jehovah?
In the pride of the wicked the poor is hotly pursued;
For the wicked boasteth of his heart’s desire,
The wicked, in the pride of his countenance, saith, He will not require it.
His ways are firm at all times;
He saith in his heart, I shall not be moved;
His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and oppression:
He sitteth in the lurking-places of the villages;
He lurketh in secret as a lion in his covert;
He croucheth, he boweth down,
He saith in his heart: God hath forgotten;
Arise, O Jehovah; O God, lift up thy hand:
Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God,
Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand:
Break thou the arm of the wicked;
Jehovah is King for ever and ever:
Jehovah, thou hast heard the desire of the meek:
To judge the fatherless and the oppressed,
In Jehovah do I take refuge:
For, lo, the wicked bend the bow,
If the foundations be destroyed,
Jehovah is in his holy temple;
Jehovah trieth the righteous;
Upon the wicked he will rain snares;
For Jehovah is righteous; he loveth righteousness:
Help, Jehovah; for the godly man ceaseth;
They speak falsehood every one with his neighbor:
Jehovah will cut off all flattering lips,
Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail;
Because of the oppression of the poor, because of the sighing of the needy,
The words of Jehovah are pure words;
Thou wilt keep them, O Jehovah,
The wicked walk on every side,
How long, O Jehovah? wilt thou forget me for ever?
How long shall I take counsel in my soul,
Consider and answer me, O Jehovah my God:
Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him;
But I have trusted in thy lovingkindness;
I will sing unto Jehovah,
The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God.
Jehovah looked down from heaven upon the children of men,
They are all gone aside; they are together become filthy;
Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge,
There were they in great fear;
Ye put to shame the counsel of the poor,
Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion!
Jehovah, who shall sojourn in thy tabernacle?
He that walketh uprightly, and worketh righteousness,
He that slandereth not with his tongue,
In whose eyes a reprobate is despised,
He that putteth not out his money to interest,
Preserve me, O God; for in thee do I take refuge.
O my soul, thou hast said unto Jehovah, Thou art my Lord:
As for the saints that are in the earth,
Their sorrows shall be multiplied that give gifts for another god:
Jehovah is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup:
The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places;
I will bless Jehovah, who hath given me counsel;
I have set Jehovah always before me:
Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth:
For thou wilt not leave my soul to Sheol;
Thou wilt show me the path of life:
Hear the right, O Jehovah, attend unto my cry;
Let my sentence come forth from thy presence;
Thou hast proved my heart; thou hast visited me in the night;
As for the works of men, by the word of thy lips
My steps have held fast to thy paths,
I have called upon thee, for thou wilt answer me, O God:
Show thy marvellous lovingkindness,
Keep me as the apple of the eye;
From the wicked that oppress me,
They are inclosed in their own fat:
They have now compassed us in our steps;
He is like a lion that is greedy of his prey,
Arise, O Jehovah,
From men by thy hand, O Jehovah,
As for me, I shall behold thy face in righteousness;
I love thee, O Jehovah, my strength.
Jehovah is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer;
I will call upon Jehovah, who is worthy to be praised:
The cords of death compassed me,
The cords of Sheol were round about me;
In my distress I called upon Jehovah,
Then the earth shook and trembled;
There went up a smoke out of his nostrils,
He bowed the heavens also, and came down;
And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly;
He made darkness his hiding-place, his pavilion round about him,
At the brightness before him his thick clouds passed,
Jehovah also thundered in the heavens,
And he sent out his arrows, and scattered them;
Then the channels of waters appeared,
He sent from on high, he took me;
He delivered me from my strong enemy,
They came upon me in the day of my calamity;
He brought me forth also into a large place;
Jehovah hath rewarded me according to my righteousness;
For I have kept the ways of Jehovah,
For all his ordinances were before me,
I was also perfect with him,
Therefore hath Jehovah recompensed me according to my righteousness,
With the merciful thou wilt show thyself merciful;
With the pure thou wilt show thyself pure;
For thou wilt save the afflicted people;
For thou wilt light my lamp:
For by thee I run upon a troop;
As for God, his way is perfect:
For who is God, save Jehovah?
The God that girdeth me with strength,
He maketh my feet like hinds’ feet:
He teacheth my hands to war;
Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation;
Thou hast enlarged my steps under me,
I will pursue mine enemies, and overtake them;
I will smite them through, so that they shall not be able to rise:
For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle:
Thou hast also made mine enemies turn their backs unto me,
They cried, but there was none to save;
Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind;
Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people;
As soon as they hear of me they shall obey me;
The foreigners shall fade away,
Jehovah liveth; and blessed be my rock;
Even the God that executeth vengeance for me,
He rescueth me from mine enemies;
Therefore I will give thanks unto thee, O Jehovah, among the nations,
Great deliverance giveth he to his king,
The heavens declare the glory of God;
Day unto day uttereth speech,
There is no speech nor language;
Their line is gone out through all the earth,
Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber,
His going forth is from the end of the heavens,
The law of Jehovah is perfect, restoring the soul:
The precepts of Jehovah are right, rejoicing the heart:
The fear of Jehovah is clean, enduring for ever:
More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold;
Moreover by them is thy servant warned:
Who can discern his errors?
Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins;
Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart
Jehovah answer thee in the day of trouble;
Send thee help from the sanctuary,
Remember all thy offerings,
Grant thee thy heart’s desire,
We will triumph in thy salvation,
Now know I that Jehovah saveth his anointed;
Some trust in chariots, and some in horses;
They are bowed down and fallen;
Save, Jehovah:
The king shall joy in thy strength, O Jehovah;
Thou hast given him his heart’s desire,
For thou meetest him with the blessings of goodness:
He asked life of thee, thou gavest it him,
His glory is great in thy salvation:
For thou makest him most blessed for ever:
For the king trusteth in Jehovah;
Thy hand will find out all thine enemies;
Thou wilt make them as a fiery furnace in the time of thine anger:
Their fruit wilt thou destroy from the earth,
For they intended evil against thee;
For thou wilt make them turn their back;
Be thou exalted, O Jehovah, in thy strength:
My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?
O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou answerest not;
But thou art holy,
Our fathers trusted in thee:
They cried unto thee, and were delivered:
But I am a worm, and no man;
All they that see me laugh me to scorn:
Commit thyself unto Jehovah; let him deliver him:
But thou art he that took me out of the womb;
I was cast upon thee from the womb;
Be not far from me; for trouble is near;
Many bulls have compassed me;
They gape upon me with their mouth,
I am poured out like water,
My strength is dried up like a potsherd;
For dogs have compassed me:
I may count all my bones.
They part my garments among them,
But be not thou far off, O Jehovah:
Deliver my soul from the sword,
Save me from the lion’s mouth;
I will declare thy name unto my brethren:
Ye that fear Jehovah, praise him;
For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted;
Of thee cometh my praise in the great assembly:
The meek shall eat and be satisfied;
All the ends of the earth shall remember and turn unto Jehovah;
For the kingdom is Jehovah’s;
All the fat ones of the earth shall eat and worship:
A seed shall serve him;
They shall come and shall declare his righteousness
Jehovah is my shepherd; I shall not want.
He maketh me to lie down in green pastures;
He restoreth my soul:
Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,
Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies:
Surely goodness and lovingkindness shall follow me all the days of my life;
The earth is Jehovah’s, and the fulness thereof;
For he hath founded it upon the seas,
Who shall ascend into the hill of Jehovah?
He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart;
He shall receive a blessing from Jehovah,
This is the generation of them that seek after him,
Lift up your heads, O ye gates;
Who is the King of glory?
Lift up your heads, O ye gates;
Who is this King of glory?
Unto thee, O Jehovah, do I lift up my soul.
O my God, in thee have I trusted,
Yea, none that wait for thee shall be put to shame:
Show me thy ways, O Jehovah;
Guide me in thy truth, and teach me;
Remember, O Jehovah, thy tender mercies and thy lovingkindness;
Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions:
Good and upright is Jehovah:
The meek will he guide in justice;
All the paths of Jehovah are lovingkindness and truth
For thy name’s sake, O Jehovah,
What man is he that feareth Jehovah?
His soul shall dwell at ease;
The friendship of Jehovah is with them that fear him;
Mine eyes are ever toward Jehovah;
Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me;
The troubles of my heart are enlarged:
Consider mine affliction and my travail;
Consider mine enemies, for they are many;
Oh keep my soul, and deliver me:
Let integrity and uprightness preserve me,
Redeem Israel, O God,
Judge me, O Jehovah, for I have walked in mine integrity:
Examine me, O Jehovah, and prove me;
For thy lovingkindness is before mine eyes;
I have not sat with men of falsehood;
I hate the assembly of evil-doers,
I will wash my hands in innocency:
That I may make the voice of thanksgiving to be heard,
Jehovah, I love the habitation of thy house,
Gather not my soul with sinners,
In whose hands is wickedness,
But as for me, I will walk in mine integrity:
My foot standeth in an even place:
Jehovah is my light and my salvation;
When evil-doers came upon me to eat up my flesh,
Though a host should encamp against me,
One thing have I asked of Jehovah, that will I seek after:
For in the day of trouble he will keep me secretly in his pavilion:
And now shall my head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me;
Hear, O Jehovah, when I cry with my voice:
When thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee,
Hide not thy face from me;
When my father and my mother forsake me,
Teach me thy way, O Jehovah;
Deliver me not over unto the will of mine adversaries:
I had fainted, unless I had believed to see the goodness of Jehovah
Wait for Jehovah:
Unto thee, O Jehovah, will I call:
Hear the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee,
Draw me not away with the wicked,
Give them according to their work, and according to the wickedness of their doings:
Because they regard not the works of Jehovah,
Blessed be Jehovah,
Jehovah is my strength and my shield;
Jehovah is their strength,
Save thy people, and bless thine inheritance:
Ascribe unto Jehovah, O ye sons of the mighty,
Ascribe unto Jehovah the glory due unto his name;
The voice of Jehovah is upon the waters:
The voice of Jehovah is powerful;
The voice of Jehovah breaketh the cedars;
He maketh them also to skip like a calf;
The voice of Jehovah cleaveth the flames of fire.
The voice of Jehovah shaketh the wilderness;
The voice of Jehovah maketh the hinds to calve,
Jehovah sat as King at the Flood;
Jehovah will give strength unto his people;
I will extol thee, O Jehovah; for thou hast raised me up,
O Jehovah my God,
O Jehovah, thou hast brought up my soul from Sheol;
Sing praise unto Jehovah, O ye saints of his,
For his anger is but for a moment;
As for me, I said in my prosperity,
Thou, Jehovah, of thy favor hadst made my mountain to stand strong:
I cried to thee, O Jehovah;
What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit?
Hear, O Jehovah, and have mercy upon me:
Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing;
To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent.
In thee, O Jehovah, do I take refuge;
Bow down thine ear unto me; deliver me speedily:
For thou art my rock and my fortress;
Pluck me out of the net that they have laid privily for me;
Into thy hand I commend my spirit:
I hate them that regard lying vanities;
I will be glad and rejoice in thy lovingkindness;
And thou hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy;
Have mercy upon me, O Jehovah, for I am in distress:
For my life is spent with sorrow,
Because of all mine adversaries I am become a reproach,
I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind:
For I have heard the defaming of many,
But I trusted in thee, O Jehovah:
My times are in thy hand:
Make thy face to shine upon thy servant:
Let me not be put to shame, O Jehovah; for I have called upon thee:
Let the lying lips be dumb,
Oh how great is thy goodness,
In the covert of thy presence wilt thou hide them from the plottings of man:
Blessed be Jehovah;
As for me, I said in my haste,
Oh love Jehovah, all ye his saints:
Be strong, and let your heart take courage,
Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven,
Blessed is the man unto whom Jehovah imputeth not iniquity,
When I kept silence, my bones wasted away
For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me:
I acknowledged my sin unto thee,
For this let every one that is godly pray unto thee in a time when thou mayest be found:
Thou art my hiding-place; thou wilt preserve me from trouble;
I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go:
Be ye not as the horse, or as the mule, which have no understanding;
Many sorrows shall be to the wicked;
Be glad in Jehovah, and rejoice, ye righteous;
Rejoice in Jehovah, O ye righteous:
Give thanks unto Jehovah with the harp:
Sing unto him a new song;
For the word of Jehovah is right;
He loveth righteousness and justice:
By the word of Jehovah were the heavens made,
He gathereth the waters of the sea together as a heap:
Let all the earth fear Jehovah:
For he spake, and it was done;
Jehovah bringeth the counsel of the nations to nought;
The counsel of Jehovah standeth fast for ever,
Blessed is the nation whose God is Jehovah,
Jehovah looketh from heaven;
From the place of his habitation he looketh forth
He that fashioneth the hearts of them all,
There is no king saved by the multitude of a host:
A horse is a vain thing for safety;
Behold, the eye of Jehovah is upon them that fear him,
To deliver their soul from death,
Our soul hath waited for Jehovah:
For our heart shall rejoice in him,
Let thy lovingkindness, O Jehovah, be upon us,
I will bless Jehovah at all times:
My soul shall make her boast in Jehovah:
Oh magnify Jehovah with me,
I sought Jehovah, and he answered me,
They looked unto him, and were radiant;
This poor man cried, and Jehovah heard him,
The angel of Jehovah encampeth round about them that fear him,
Oh taste and see that Jehovah is good:
Oh fear Jehovah, ye his saints;
The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger;
Come, ye children, hearken unto me:
What man is he that desireth life,
Keep thy tongue from evil,
Depart from evil, and do good;
The eyes of Jehovah are toward the righteous,
The face of Jehovah is against them that do evil,
The righteous cried, and Jehovah heard,
Jehovah is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart,
Many are the afflictions of the righteous;
He keepeth all his bones:
Evil shall slay the wicked;
Jehovah redeemeth the soul of his servants;
Strive thou, O Jehovah, with them that strive with me:
Take hold of shield and buckler,
Draw out also the spear, and stop the way against them that pursue me:
Let them be put to shame and brought to dishonor that seek after my soul:
Let them be as chaff before the wind,
Let their way be dark and slippery,
For without cause have they hid for me their net in a pit;
Let destruction come upon him unawares;
And my soul shall be joyful in Jehovah:
All my bones shall say, Jehovah, who is like unto thee,
Unrighteous witnesses rise up;
They reward me evil for good,
But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth:
I behaved myself as though it had been my friend or my brother:
But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together:
Like the profane mockers in feasts,
Lord, how long wilt thou look on?
I will give thee thanks in the great assembly:
Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me;
For they speak not peace;
Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me;
Thou hast seen it, O Jehovah; keep not silence:
Stir up thyself, and awake to the justice due unto me,
Judge me, O Jehovah my God, according to thy righteousness;
Let them not say in their heart, Aha, so would we have it:
Let them be put to shame and confounded together that rejoice at my hurt:
Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favor my righteous cause:
And my tongue shall talk of thy righteousness
The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart,
For he flattereth himself in his own eyes,
The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit:
He deviseth iniquity upon his bed;
Thy lovingkindness, O Jehovah, is in the heavens;
Thy righteousness is like the mountains of God;
How precious is thy lovingkindness, O God!
They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house;
For with thee is the fountain of life:
Oh continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee,
Let not the foot of pride come against me,
There are the workers of iniquity fallen:
Fret not thyself because of evil-doers,
For they shall soon be cut down like the grass,
Trust in Jehovah, and do good;
Delight thyself also in Jehovah;
Commit thy way unto Jehovah;
And he will make thy righteousness to go forth as the light,
Rest in Jehovah, and wait patiently for him:
Cease from anger, and forsake wrath:
For evil-doers shall be cut off;
For yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be:
But the meek shall inherit the land,
The wicked plotteth against the just,
The Lord will laugh at him;
The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow,
Their sword shall enter into their own heart,
Better is a little that the righteous hath
For the arms of the wicked shall be broken;
Jehovah knoweth the days of the perfect;
They shall not be put to shame in the time of evil;
But the wicked shall perish,
The wicked borroweth, and payeth not again;
For such as are blessed of him shall inherit the land;
A man’s goings are established of Jehovah;
Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down;
I have been young, and now am old;
All the day long he dealeth graciously, and lendeth;
Depart from evil, and do good;
For Jehovah loveth justice,
The righteous shall inherit the land,
The mouth of the righteous talketh of wisdom,
The law of his God is in his heart;
The wicked watcheth the righteous,
Jehovah will not leave him in his hand,
Wait for Jehovah, and keep his way,
I have seen the wicked in great power,
But one passed by, and, lo, he was not:
Mark the perfect man, and behold the upright;
As for transgressors, they shall be destroyed together:
But the salvation of the righteous is of Jehovah:
And Jehovah helpeth them, and rescueth them:
O Jehovah, rebuke me not in thy wrath;
For thine arrows stick fast in me,
There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine indignation;
For mine iniquities are gone over my head:
My wounds are loathsome and corrupt,
I am pained and bowed down greatly;
For my loins are filled with burning;
I am faint and sore bruised:
Lord, all my desire is before thee;
My heart throbbeth, my strength faileth me:
My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my plague;
They also that seek after my life lay snares for me;
But I, as a deaf man, hear not;
Yea, I am as a man that heareth not,
For in thee, O Jehovah, do I hope:
For I said, Lest they rejoice over me:
For I am ready to fall,
For I will declare mine iniquity;
But mine enemies are lively, and are strong;
They also that render evil for good
Forsake me not, O Jehovah:
Make haste to help me,
I said, I will take heed to my ways,
I was dumb with silence, I held my peace, even from good;
My heart was hot within me;
Jehovah, make me to know mine end,
Behold, thou hast made my days as handbreadths;
Surely every man walketh in a vain show;
And now, Lord, what wait I for?
Deliver me from all my transgressions:
I was dumb, I opened not my mouth;
Remove thy stroke away from me:
When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity,
Hear my prayer, O Jehovah, and give ear unto my cry;
Oh spare me, that I may recover strength,
I waited patiently for Jehovah;
He brought me up also out of a horrible pit, out of the miry clay;
And he hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God:
Blessed is the man that maketh Jehovah his trust,
Many, O Jehovah my God, are the wonderful works which thou hast done,
Sacrifice and offering thou hast no delight in;
Then said I, Lo, I am come;
I delight to do thy will, O my God;
I have proclaimed glad tidings of righteousness in the great assembly;
I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart;
Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O Jehovah;
For innumerable evils have compassed me about;
Be pleased, O Jehovah, to deliver me:
Let them be put to shame and confounded together
Let them be desolate by reason of their shame
Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee:
But I am poor and needy;
Blessed is he that considereth the poor:
Jehovah will preserve him, and keep him alive,
Jehovah will support him upon the couch of languishing:
I said, O Jehovah, have mercy upon me:
Mine enemies speak evil against me, saying,
And if he come to see me, he speaketh falsehood;
All that hate me whisper together against me;
An evil disease, say they, cleaveth fast unto him;
Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted,
But thou, O Jehovah, have mercy upon me, and raise me up,
By this I know that thou delightest in me,
And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity,
Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel,
As the hart panteth after the water brooks,
My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God:
My tears have been my food day and night,
These things I remember, and pour out my soul within me,
Why art thou cast down, O my soul?
O my God, my soul is cast down within me:
Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterfalls:
Yet Jehovah will command his lovingkindness in the day-time;
I will say unto God my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me?
As with a sword in my bones, mine adversaries reproach me,
Why art thou cast down, O my soul?
Judge me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation:
For thou art the God of my strength; why hast thou cast me off?
Oh send out thy light and thy truth; let them lead me:
Then will I go unto the altar of God,
Why art thou cast down, O my soul?
We have heard with our ears, O God,
Thou didst drive out the nations with thy hand;
For they gat not the land in possession by their own sword,
Thou art my King, O God:
Through thee will we push down our adversaries:
For I will not trust in my bow,
But thou hast saved us from our adversaries,
In God have we made our boast all the day long,
But now thou hast cast us off, and brought us to dishonor,
Thou makest us to turn back from the adversary;
Thou hast made us like sheep appointed for food,
Thou sellest thy people for nought,
Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbors,
Thou makest us a byword among the nations,
All the day long is my dishonor before me,
For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth,
All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee,
Our heart is not turned back,
That thou hast sore broken us in the place of jackals,
If we have forgotten the name of our God,
Will not God search this out?
Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long;
Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord?
Wherefore hidest thou thy face,
For our soul is bowed down to the dust:
Rise up for our help,
My heart overfloweth with a goodly matter;
Thou art fairer than the children of men;
Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O mighty one,
And in thy majesty ride on prosperously,
Thine arrows are sharp;
Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever:
Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated wickedness:
All thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia;
Kings’ daughters are among thy honorable women:
Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear;
So will the king desire thy beauty;
And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift;
The king’s daughter within the palace is all glorious:
She shall be led unto the king in broidered work:
With gladness and rejoicing shall they be led:
Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children,
I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations:
God is our refuge and strength,
Therefore will we not fear, though the earth do change,
Though the waters thereof roar and be troubled,
There is a river, the streams whereof make glad the city of God,
God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved:
The nations raged, the kingdoms were moved:
Jehovah of hosts is with us;
Come, behold the works of Jehovah,
He maketh wars to cease unto the end of the earth;
Be still, and know that I am God:
Jehovah of hosts is with us;
Oh clap your hands, all ye peoples;
For Jehovah Most High is terrible;
He subdueth peoples under us,
He chooseth our inheritance for us,
God is gone up with a shout,
Sing praises to God, sing praises:
For God is the King of all the earth:
God reigneth over the nations:
The princes of the peoples are gathered together
Great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised,
Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth,
God hath made himself known in her palaces for a refuge.
For, lo, the kings assembled themselves,
They saw it, then were they amazed;
Trembling took hold of them there,
With the east wind
As we have heard, so have we seen
We have thought on thy lovingkindness, O God,
As is thy name, O God,
Let mount Zion be glad,
Walk about Zion, and go round about her;
Mark ye well her bulwarks;
For this God is our God for ever and ever:
Hear this, all ye peoples;
Both low and high,
My mouth shall speak wisdom;
I will incline mine ear to a parable:
Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil,
They that trust in their wealth,
None of them can by any means redeem his brother,
(For the redemption of their life is costly,
That he should still live alway,
For he shall see it. Wise men die;
Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever,
But man being in honor abideth not:
This their way is their folly:
They are appointed as a flock for Sheol;
But God will redeem my soul from the power of Sheol;
Be not thou afraid when one is made rich,
For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away;
Though while he lived he blessed his soul
He shall go to the generation of his fathers;
Man that is in honor, and understandeth not,
The Mighty One, God, Jehovah, hath spoken,
Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty,
Our God cometh, and doth not keep silence:
He calleth to the heavens above,
Gather my saints together unto me,
And the heavens shall declare his righteousness;
Hear, O my people, and I will speak;
I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices;
I will take no bullock out of thy house,
For every beast of the forest is mine,
I know all the birds of the mountains;
If I were hungry, I would not tell thee;
Will I eat the flesh of bulls,
Offer unto God the sacrifice of thanksgiving;
And call upon me in the day of trouble:
But unto the wicked God saith,
Seeing that thou hatest instruction,
When thou sawest a thief, thou consentedst with him,
Thou givest thy mouth to evil,
Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother;
These things hast thou done, and I kept silence;
Now consider this, ye that forget God,
Whoso offereth the sacrifice of thanksgiving glorifieth me;
Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness:
Wash me thoroughly from mine iniquity,
For I know my transgressions;
Against thee, thee only, have I sinned,
Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity;
Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts;
Purify me with hyssop, and I shall be clean:
Make me to hear joy and gladness,
Hide thy face from my sins,
Create in me a clean heart, O God;
Cast me not away from thy presence;
Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation;
Then will I teach transgressors thy ways;
Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation;
O Lord, open thou my lips;
For thou delightest not in sacrifice; else would I give it:
The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit:
Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion:
Then wilt thou delight in the sacrifices of righteousness,
Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man?
Thy tongue deviseth very wickedness,
Thou lovest evil more than good,
Thou lovest all devouring words,
God will likewise destroy thee for ever;
The righteous also shall see it, and fear,
Lo, this is the man that made not God his strength,
But as for me, I am like a green olive-tree in the house of God:
I will give thee thanks for ever, because thou hast done it;
The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God.
God looked down from heaven upon the children of men,
Every one of them is gone back; they are together become filthy;
Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge,
There were they in great fear, where no fear was;
Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion!
Save me, O God, by thy name,
Hear my prayer, O God;
For strangers are risen up against me,
Behold, God is my helper:
He will requite the evil unto mine enemies:
With a freewill-offering will I sacrifice unto thee:
For he hath delivered me out of all trouble;
Give ear to my prayer, O God;
Attend unto me, and answer me:
Because of the voice of the enemy,
My heart is sore pained within me:
Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me,
And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove!
Lo, then would I wander far off,
I would haste me to a shelter
Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongue;
Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof:
Wickedness is in the midst thereof:
For it was not an enemy that reproached me;
But it was thou, a man mine equal,
We took sweet counsel together;
Let death come suddenly upon them,
As for me, I will call upon God;
Evening, and morning, and at noonday, will I complain, and moan;
He hath redeemed my soul in peace from the battle that was against me;
God will hear, and answer them,
He hath put forth his hands against such as were at peace with him:
His mouth was smooth as butter,
Cast thy burden upon Jehovah, and he will sustain thee:
But thou, O God, wilt bring them down into the pit of destruction:
Be merciful unto me, O God; for man would swallow me up:
Mine enemies would swallow me up all the day long;
What time I am afraid,
In God (I will praise his word),
All the day long they wrest my words:
They gather themselves together, they hide themselves,
Shall they escape by iniquity?
Thou numberest my wanderings:
Then shall mine enemies turn back in the day that I call:
In God (I will praise his word),
In God have I put my trust, I will not be afraid;
Thy vows are upon me, O God:
For thou hast delivered my soul from death:
Be merciful unto me, O God, be merciful unto me;
I will cry unto God Most High,
He will send from heaven, and save me,
My soul is among lions;
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens;
They have prepared a net for my steps;
My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed:
Awake up, my glory; awake, psaltery and harp:
I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the peoples:
For thy lovingkindness is great unto the heavens,
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens;
Do ye indeed in silence speak righteousness?
Nay, in heart ye work wickedness;
The wicked are estranged from the womb:
Their poison is like the poison of a serpent:
Which hearkeneth not to the voice of charmers,
Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth:
Let them melt away as water that runneth apace:
Let them be as a snail which melteth and passeth away,
Before your pots can feel the thorns,
The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance:
So that men shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous:
Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God:
Deliver me from the workers of iniquity,
For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul;
They run and prepare themselves without my fault:
Even thou, O Jehovah God of hosts, the God of Israel,
They return at evening, they howl like a dog,
Behold, they belch out with their mouth;
But thou, O Jehovah, wilt laugh at them;
Because of his strength I will give heed unto thee;
My God with his lovingkindness will meet me:
Slay them not, lest my people forget:
For the sin of their mouth, and the words of their lips,
Consume them in wrath, consume them, so that they shall be no more:
And at evening let them return, let them howl like a dog,
They shall wander up and down for food,
But I will sing of thy strength;
Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing praises:
O God thou hast cast us off, thou hast broken us down;
Thou hast made the land to tremble; thou hast rent it:
Thou hast showed thy people hard things:
Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee,
That thy beloved may be delivered,
God hath spoken in his holiness: I will exult;
Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;
Moab is my washpot;
Who will bring me into the strong city?
Hast not thou, O God, cast us off?
Give us help against the adversary;
Through God we shall do valiantly;
Hear my cry, O God;
From the end of the earth will I call unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed:
For thou hast been a refuge for me,
I will dwell in thy tabernacle for ever:
For thou, O God, hast heard my vows:
Thou wilt prolong the king’s life;
He shall abide before God for ever:
So will I sing praise unto thy name for ever,
My soul waiteth in silence for God only:
He only is my rock and my salvation:
How long will ye set upon a man,
They only consult to thrust him down from his dignity;
My soul, wait thou in silence for God only;
He only is my rock and my salvation:
With God is my salvation and my glory:
Trust in him at all times, ye people;
Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie:
Trust not in oppression,
God hath spoken once,
Also unto thee, O Lord, belongeth lovingkindness;
O God, thou art my God; earnestly will I seek thee:
So have I looked upon thee in the sanctuary,
Because thy lovingkindness is better than life,
So will I bless thee while I live:
My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness;
When I remember thee upon my bed,
For thou hast been my help,
My soul followeth hard after thee:
But those that seek my soul, to destroy it,
They shall be given over to the power of the sword:
But the king shall rejoice in God:
Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint:
Hide me from the secret counsel of evil-doers,
Who have whet their tongue like a sword,
That they may shoot in secret places at the perfect:
They encourage themselves in an evil purpose;
They search out iniquities;
But God will shoot at them;
So they shall be made to stumble, their own tongue being against them:
And all men shall fear;
The righteous shall be glad in Jehovah, and shall take refuge in him;
Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Zion;
O thou that hearest prayer,
Iniquities prevail against me:
Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach unto thee,
By terrible things thou wilt answer us in righteousness,
Who by his strength setteth fast the mountains,
Who stilleth the roaring of the seas,
They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens:
Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it,
Thou waterest its furrows abundantly;
Thou crownest the year with thy goodness;
They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness;
The pastures are clothed with flocks;
Make a joyful noise unto God, all the earth:
Sing forth the glory of his name:
Say unto God, How terrible are thy works!
All the earth shall worship thee,
Come, and see the works of God;
He turned the sea into dry land;
He ruleth by his might for ever;
Oh bless our God, ye peoples,
Who holdeth our soul in life,
For thou, O God, hast proved us:
Thou broughtest us into the net;
Thou didst cause men to ride over our heads;
I will come into thy house with burnt-offerings;
Which my lips uttered,
I will offer unto thee burnt-offerings of fatlings,
Come, and hear, all ye that fear God,
I cried unto him with my mouth,
If I regard iniquity in my heart,
But verily God hath heard;
Blessed be God,
God be merciful unto us, and bless us,
That thy way may be known upon earth,
Let the peoples praise thee, O God;
Oh let the nations be glad and sing for joy;
Let the peoples praise thee, O God;
The earth hath yielded its increase:
God will bless us;
Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered;
As smoke is driven away, so drive them away:
But let the righteous be glad; let them exult before God:
Sing unto God, sing praises to his name:
A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows,
God setteth the solitary in families:
O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people,
The earth trembled,
Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain,
Thy congregation dwelt therein:
The Lord giveth the word:
Kings of armies flee, they flee;
When ye lie among the sheepfolds,
When the Almighty scattered kings therein,
A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan;
Why look ye askance, ye high mountains,
The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands upon thousands:
Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led away captives;
Blessed be the Lord, who daily beareth our burden,
God is unto us a God of deliverances;
But God will smite through the head of his enemies,
The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan,
That thou mayest crush them, dipping thy foot in blood,
They have seen thy goings, O God,
The singers went before, the minstrels followed after,
Bless ye God in the congregations,
There is little Benjamin their ruler,
Thy God hath commanded thy strength:
Because of thy temple at Jerusalem
Rebuke the wild beast of the reeds,
Princes shall come out of Egypt;
Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth;
To him that rideth upon the heaven of heavens, which are of old;
Ascribe ye strength unto God:
O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places:
Save me, O God;
I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing:
I am weary with my crying; my throat is dried:
They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head:
O God, thou knowest my foolishness;
Let not them that wait for thee be put to shame through me, O Lord Jehovah of hosts:
Because for thy sake I have borne reproach;
I am become a stranger unto my brethren,
For the zeal of thy house hath eaten me up;
When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting,
When I made sackcloth my clothing,
They that sit in the gate talk of me;
But as for me, my prayer is unto thee, O Jehovah, in an acceptable time:
Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink:
Let not the waterflood overwhelm me,
Answer me, O Jehovah; for thy lovingkindness is good:
And hide not thy face from thy servant;
Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it:
Thou knowest my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonor:
Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness:
They gave me also gall for my food;
Let their table before them become a snare;
Let their eyes be darkened, so that they cannot see;
Pour out thine indignation upon them,
Let their habitation be desolate;
For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten;
Add iniquity unto their iniquity;
Let them be blotted out of the book of life,
But I am poor and sorrowful:
I will praise the name of God with a song,
And it will please Jehovah better than an ox,
The meek have seen it, and are glad:
For Jehovah heareth the needy,
Let heaven and earth praise him,
For God will save Zion, and build the cities of Judah;
The seed also of his servants shall inherit it;
Make haste, O God, to deliver me;
Let them be put to shame and confounded
Let them be turned back by reason of their shame
Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee;
But I am poor and needy;
In thee, O Jehovah, do I take refuge:
Deliver me in thy righteousness, and rescue me:
Be thou to me a rock of habitation, whereunto I may continually resort:
Rescue me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked,
For thou art my hope, O Lord Jehovah:
By thee have I been holden up from the womb;
I am as a wonder unto many;
My mouth shall be filled with thy praise,
Cast me not off in the time of old age;
For mine enemies speak concerning me;
Saying, God hath forsaken him:
O God, be not far from me;
Let them be put to shame and consumed that are adversaries to my soul;
But I will hope continually,
My mouth shall tell of thy righteousness,
I will come with the mighty acts of the Lord Jehovah:
O God, thou hast taught me from my youth;
Yea, even when I am old and grayheaded, O God, forsake me not,
Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high;
Thou, who hast showed us many and sore troubles,
Increase thou my greatness,
I will also praise thee with the psaltery,
My lips shall shout for joy when I sing praises unto thee;
My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long;
Give the king thy judgments, O God,
He will judge thy people with righteousness,
The mountains shall bring peace to the people,
He will judge the poor of the people,
They shall fear thee while the sun endureth,
He will come down like rain upon the mown grass,
In his days shall the righteous flourish,
He shall have dominion also from sea to sea,
They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him;
The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall render tribute:
Yea, all kings shall fall down before him;
For he will deliver the needy when he crieth,
He will have pity on the poor and needy,
He will redeem their soul from oppression and violence;
And they shall live; and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba:
There shall be abundance of grain in the earth upon the top of the mountains;
His name shall endure for ever;
Blessed be Jehovah God, the God of Israel,
And blessed be his glorious name for ever;
The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.
Surely God is good to Israel,
But as for me, my feet were almost gone;
For I was envious at the arrogant,
For there are no pangs in their death;
They are not in trouble as other men;
Therefore pride is as a chain about their neck;
Their eyes stand out with fatness:
They scoff, and in wickedness utter oppression:
They have set their mouth in the heavens,
Therefore his people return hither:
And they say, How doth God know?
Behold, these are the wicked;
Surely in vain have I cleansed my heart,
For all the day long have I been plagued,
If I had said, I will speak thus;
When I thought how I might know this,
Until I went into the sanctuary of God,
Surely thou settest them in slippery places:
How are they become a desolation in a moment!
As a dream when one awaketh,
For my soul was grieved,
So brutish was I, and ignorant;
Nevertheless I am continually with thee:
Thou wilt guide me with thy counsel,
Whom have I in heaven but thee?
My flesh and my heart faileth;
For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish:
But it is good for me to draw near unto God:
O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever?
Remember thy congregation, which thou hast gotten of old,
Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual ruins,
Thine adversaries have roared in the midst of thine assembly;
They seemed as men that lifted up
And now all the carved work thereof
They have set thy sanctuary on fire;
They said in their heart, Let us make havoc of them altogether:
We see not our signs:
How long, O God, shall the adversary reproach?
Why drawest thou back thy hand, even thy right hand?
Yet God is my King of old,
Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength:
Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces;
Thou didst cleave fountain and flood:
The day is thine, the night also is thine:
Thou hast set all the borders of the earth:
Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached, O Jehovah,
Oh deliver not the soul of thy turtle-dove unto the wild beast:
Have respect unto the covenant;
Oh let not the oppressed return ashamed:
Arise, O God, plead thine own cause:
Forget not the voice of thine adversaries:
We give thanks unto thee, O God;
When I shall find the set time,
The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved:
I said unto the arrogant, Deal not arrogantly;
Lift not up your horn on high;
For neither from the east, nor from the west,
But God is the judge:
For in the hand of Jehovah there is a cup, and the wine foameth;
But I will declare for ever,
All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off;
In Judah is God known:
In Salem also is his tabernacle,
There he brake the arrows of the bow;
Glorious art thou and excellent,
The stouthearted are made a spoil,
At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob,
Thou, even thou, art to be feared;
Thou didst cause sentence to be heard from heaven;
When God arose to judgment,
Surely the wrath of man shall praise thee:
Vow, and pay unto Jehovah your God:
He will cut off the spirit of princes:
I will cry unto God with my voice,
In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord:
I remember God, and am disquieted:
Thou holdest mine eyes watching:
I have considered the days of old,
I call to remembrance my song in the night:
Will the Lord cast off for ever?
Is his lovingkindness clean gone for ever?
Hath God forgotten to be gracious?
And I said, This is my infirmity;
I will make mention of the deeds of Jehovah;
I will meditate also upon all thy work,
Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary:
Thou art the God that doest wonders:
Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people,
The waters saw thee, O God;
The clouds poured out water;
The voice of thy thunder was in the whirlwind;
Thy way was in the sea,
Thou leddest thy people like a flock,
Give ear, O my people, to my law:
I will open my mouth in a parable;
Which we have heard and known,
We will not hide them from their children,
For he established a testimony in Jacob,
That the generation to come might know them, even the children that should be born;
That they might set their hope in God,
And might not be as their fathers,
The children of Ephraim, being armed and carrying bows,
They kept not the covenant of God,
And they forgat his doings,
Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers,
He clave the sea, and caused them to pass through;
In the day-time also he led them with a cloud,
He clave rocks in the wilderness,
He brought streams also out of the rock,
Yet went they on still to sin against him,
And they tempted God in their heart
Yea, they spake against God;
Behold, he smote the rock, so that waters gushed out,
Therefore Jehovah heard, and was wroth;
Because they believed not in God,
Yet he commanded the skies above,
And he rained down manna upon them to eat,
Man did eat the bread of the mighty:
He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens;
He rained flesh also upon them as the dust,
And he let it fall in the midst of their camp,
So they did eat, and were well filled;
They were not estranged from that which they desired,
When the anger of God went up against them,
For all this they sinned still,
Therefore their days did he consume in vanity,
When he slew them, then they inquired after him;
And they remembered that God was their rock,
But they flattered him with their mouth,
For their heart was not right with him,
But he, being merciful, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not:
And he remembered that they were but flesh,
How oft did they rebel against him in the wilderness,
And they turned again and tempted God,
They remembered not his hand,
How he set his signs in Egypt,
And turned their rivers into blood,
He sent among them swarms of flies, which devoured them;
He gave also their increase unto the caterpillar,
He destroyed their vines with hail,
He gave over their cattle also to the hail,
He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger,
He made a path for his anger;
And smote all the first-born in Egypt,
But he led forth his own people like sheep,
And he led them safely, so that they feared not;
And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary,
He drove out the nations also before them,
Yet they tempted and rebelled against the Most High God,
But turned back, and dealt treacherously like their fathers:
For they provoked him to anger with their high places,
When God heard this, he was wroth,
So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh,
And delivered his strength into captivity,
He gave his people over also unto the sword,
Fire devoured their young men;
Their priests fell by the sword;
Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep,
And he smote his adversaries backward:
Moreover he refused the tent of Joseph,
But chose the tribe of Judah,
And he built his sanctuary like the heights,
He chose David also his servant,
From following the ewes that have their young he brought him,
So he was their shepherd according to the integrity of his heart,
O God, the nations are come into thine inheritance;
The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be food unto the birds of the heavens,
Their blood have they shed like water round about Jerusalem;
We are become a reproach to our neighbors,
How long, O Jehovah? wilt thou be angry for ever?
Pour out thy wrath upon the nations that know thee not,
For they have devoured Jacob,
Remember not against us the iniquities of our forefathers:
Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy name;
Wherefore should the nations say, Where is their God?
Let the sighing of the prisoner come before thee:
And render unto our neighbors sevenfold into their bosom
So we thy people and sheep of thy pasture
Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel,
Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up thy might,
Turn us again, O God;
O Jehovah God of hosts,
Thou hast fed them with the bread of tears,
Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbors;
Turn us again, O God of hosts;
Thou broughtest a vine out of Egypt:
Thou preparedst room before it,
The mountains were covered with the shadow of it,
It sent out its branches unto the sea,
Why hast thou broken down its walls,
The boar out of the wood doth ravage it,
Turn again, we beseech thee, O God of hosts:
And the stock which thy right hand planted,
It is burned with fire, it is cut down:
Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand,
So shall we not go back from thee:
Turn us again, O Jehovah God of hosts;
Sing aloud unto God our strength:
Raise a song, and bring hither the timbrel,
Blow the trumpet at the new moon,
For it is a statute for Israel,
He appointed it in Joseph for a testimony,
I removed his shoulder from the burden:
Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee;
Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee:
There shall no strange god be in thee;
I am Jehovah thy God,
But my people hearkened not to my voice;
So I let them go after the stubbornness of their heart,
Oh that my people would hearken unto me,
I would soon subdue their enemies,
The haters of Jehovah should submit themselves unto him:
He would feed them also with the finest of the wheat;
God standeth in the congregation of God;
How long will ye judge unjustly,
Judge the poor and fatherless:
Rescue the poor and needy:
They know not, neither do they understand;
I said, Ye are gods,
Nevertheless ye shall die like men,
Arise, O God, judge the earth;
O God, keep not thou silence:
For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult;
They take crafty counsel against thy people,
They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation;
For they have consulted together with one consent;
The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites;
Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek;
Assyria also is joined with them;
Do thou unto them as unto Midian,
Who perished at Endor,
Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb;
Who said, Let us take to ourselves in possession
O my God, make them like the whirling dust;
As the fire that burneth the forest,
So pursue them with thy tempest,
Fill their faces with confusion,
Let them be put to shame and dismayed for ever;
That they may know that thou alone, whose name is Jehovah,
How amiable are thy tabernacles,
My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of Jehovah;
Yea, the sparrow hath found her a house,
Blessed are they that dwell in thy house:
Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee;
Passing through the valley of Weeping they make it a place of springs;
They go from strength to strength;
O Jehovah God of hosts, hear my prayer;
Behold, O God our shield,
For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand.
For Jehovah God is a sun and a shield:
O Jehovah of hosts,
Jehovah, thou hast been favorable unto thy land;
Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people;
Thou hast taken away all thy wrath;
Turn us, O God of our salvation,
Wilt thou be angry with us for ever?
Wilt thou not quicken us again,
Show us thy lovingkindness, O Jehovah,
I will hear what God Jehovah will speak;
Surely his salvation is nigh them that fear him,
Mercy and truth are met together;
Truth springeth out of the earth;
Yea, Jehovah will give that which is good;
Righteousness shall go before him,
Bow down thine ear, O Jehovah, and answer me;
Preserve my soul; for I am godly:
Be merciful unto me, O Lord;
Rejoice the soul of thy servant;
For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive,
Give ear, O Jehovah, unto my prayer;
In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee;
There is none like unto thee among the gods, O Lord;
All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before thee, O Lord;
For thou art great, and doest wondrous things:
Teach me thy way, O Jehovah; I will walk in thy truth:
I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with my whole heart;
For great is thy lovingkindness toward me;
O God, the proud are risen up against me,
But thou, O Lord, art a God merciful and gracious,
Oh turn unto me, and have mercy upon me;
Show me a token for good,
His foundation is in the holy mountains.
Jehovah loveth the gates of Zion
Glorious things are spoken of thee,
I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon as among them that know me:
Yea, of Zion it shall be said, This one and that one was born in her;
Jehovah will count, when he writeth up the peoples,
They that sing as well as they that dance shall say,
O Jehovah, the God of my salvation,
Let my prayer enter into thy presence;
For my soul is full of troubles,
I am reckoned with them that go down into the pit;
Cast off among the dead,
Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit,
Thy wrath lieth hard upon me,
Thou hast put mine acquaintance far from me;
Mine eye wasteth away by reason of affliction:
Wilt thou show wonders to the dead?
Shall thy lovingkindness be declared in the grave?
Shall thy wonders be known in the dark?
But unto thee, O Jehovah, have I cried;
Jehovah, why castest thou off my soul?
I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up:
Thy fierce wrath is gone over me;
They came round about me like water all the day long;
Lover and friend hast thou put far from me,
I will sing of the lovingkindness of Jehovah for ever:
For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever;
I have made a covenant with my chosen,
Thy seed will I establish for ever,
And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O Jehovah;
For who in the skies can be compared unto Jehovah?
A God very terrible in the council of the holy ones,
O Jehovah God of hosts,
Thou rulest the pride of the sea:
Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain;
The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine:
The north and the south, thou hast created them:
Thou hast a mighty arm;
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of thy throne:
Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound:
In thy name do they rejoice all the day;
For thou art the glory of their strength;
For our shield belongeth unto Jehovah;
Then thou spakest in vision to thy saints,
I have found David my servant;
With whom my hand shall be established;
The enemy shall not exact from him,
And I will beat down his adversaries before him,
But my faithfulness and my lovingkindness shall be with him;
I will set his hand also on the sea,
He shall cry unto me, Thou art my Father,
I also will make him my first-born,
My lovingkindness will I keep for him for evermore;
His seed also will I make to endure for ever,
If his children forsake my law,
If they break my statutes,
Then will I visit their transgression with the rod,
But my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him,
My covenant will I not break,
Once have I sworn by my holiness:
His seed shall endure for ever,
It shall be established for ever as the moon,
But thou hast cast off and rejected,
Thou hast abhorred the covenant of thy servant:
Thou hast broken down all his hedges;
All that pass by the way rob him:
Thou hast exalted the right hand of his adversaries;
Yea, thou turnest back the edge of his sword,
Thou hast made his brightness to cease,
The days of his youth hast thou shortened:
How long, O Jehovah? wilt thou hide thyself for ever?
Oh remember how short my time is:
What man is he that shall live and not see death,
Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses,
Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants;
Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O Jehovah,
Blessed be Jehovah for evermore.
Lord, thou hast been our dwelling-place
Before the mountains were brought forth,
Thou turnest man to destruction,
For a thousand years in thy sight
Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep:
In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up;
For we are consumed in thine anger,
Thou hast set our iniquities before thee,
For all our days are passed away in thy wrath:
The days of our years are threescore years and ten,
Who knoweth the power of thine anger,
So teach us to number our days,
Return, O Jehovah; how long?
Oh satisfy us in the morning with thy lovingkindness,
Make us glad according to the days wherein thou hast afflicted us,
Let thy work appear unto thy servants,
And let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us;
He that dwelleth in the secret place of the Most High
I will say of Jehovah, He is my refuge and my fortress;
For he will deliver thee from the snare of the fowler,
He will cover thee with his pinions,
Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night,
For the pestilence that walketh in darkness,
A thousand shall fall at thy side,
Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold,
For thou, O Jehovah, art my refuge!
There shall no evil befall thee,
For he will give his angels charge over thee,
They shall bear thee up in their hands,
Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder:
Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him:
He shall call upon me, and I will answer him;
With long life will I satisfy him,
It is a good thing to give thanks unto Jehovah,
To show forth thy lovingkindness in the morning,
With an instrument of ten strings, and with the psaltery;
For thou, Jehovah, hast made me glad through thy work:
How great are thy works, O Jehovah!
A brutish man knoweth not;
When the wicked spring as the grass,
But thou, O Jehovah, art on high for evermore.
For, lo, thine enemies, O Jehovah,
But my horn hast thou exalted like the horn of the wild-ox:
Mine eye also hath seen my desire on mine enemies,
The righteous shall flourish like the palm-tree:
They are planted in the house of Jehovah;
They shall still bring forth fruit in old age;
To show that Jehovah is upright;
Jehovah reigneth; he is clothed with majesty;
Thy throne is established of old:
The floods have lifted up, O Jehovah,
Above the voices of many waters,
Thy testimonies are very sure:
O Jehovah, thou God to whom vengeance belongeth,
Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth:
Jehovah, how long shall the wicked,
They prate, they speak arrogantly:
They break in pieces thy people, O Jehovah,
They slay the widow and the sojourner,
And they say, Jehovah will not see,
Consider, ye brutish among the people;
He that planted the ear, shall he not hear?
He that chastiseth the nations, shall not he correct,
Jehovah knoweth the thoughts of man,
Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O Jehovah,
That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity,
For Jehovah will not cast off his people,
For judgment shall return unto righteousness;
Who will rise up for me against the evil-doers?
Unless Jehovah had been my help,
When I said, My foot slippeth;
In the multitude of my thoughts within me
Shall the throne of wickedness have fellowship with thee,
They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous,
But Jehovah hath been my high tower,
And he hath brought upon them their own iniquity,
Oh come, let us sing unto Jehovah;
Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving;
For Jehovah is a great God,
In his hand are the deep places of the earth;
The sea is his, and he made it;
Oh come, let us worship and bow down;
For he is our God,
Harden not your heart, as at Meribah,
When your fathers tempted me,
Forty years long was I grieved with that generation,
Wherefore I sware in my wrath,
Oh sing unto Jehovah a new song:
Sing unto Jehovah, bless his name;
Declare his glory among the nations,
For great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised:
For all the gods of the peoples are idols;
Honor and majesty are before him:
Ascribe unto Jehovah, ye kindreds of the peoples,
Ascribe unto Jehovah the glory due unto his name:
Oh worship Jehovah in holy array:
Say among the nations, Jehovah reigneth:
Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice;
Let the field exult, and all that is therein;
Before Jehovah; for he cometh,
Jehovah reigneth; let the earth rejoice;
Clouds and darkness are round about him:
A fire goeth before him,
His lightnings lightened the world:
The mountains melted like wax at the presence of Jehovah,
The heavens declare his righteousness,
Let all them be put to shame that serve graven images,
Zion heard and was glad,
For thou, Jehovah, art most high above all the earth:
O ye that love Jehovah, hate evil:
Light is sown for the righteous,
Be glad in Jehovah, ye righteous;
Oh sing unto Jehovah a new song;
Jehovah hath made known his salvation:
He hath remembered his lovingkindness and his faithfulness toward the house of Israel:
Make a joyful noise unto Jehovah, all the earth:
Sing praises unto Jehovah with the harp;
With trumpets and sound of cornet
Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof;
Let the floods clap their hands;
Before Jehovah; for he cometh to judge the earth:
Jehovah reigneth; let the peoples tremble:
Jehovah is great in Zion;
Let them praise thy great and terrible name:
The king’s strength also loveth justice;
Exalt ye Jehovah our God,
Moses and Aaron among his priests,
He spake unto them in the pillar of cloud:
Thou answeredst them, O Jehovah our God:
Exalt ye Jehovah our God,
Make a joyful noise unto Jehovah, all ye lands.
Serve Jehovah with gladness:
Know ye that Jehovah, he is God:
Enter into his gates with thanksgiving,
For Jehovah is good; his lovingkindness endureth for ever,
I will sing of lovingkindness and justice:
I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way:
I will set no base thing before mine eyes:
A perverse heart shall depart from me:
Whoso privily slandereth his neighbor, him will I destroy:
Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me:
He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house:
Morning by morning will I destroy all the wicked of the land;
Hear my prayer, O Jehovah,
Hide not thy face from me in the day of my distress:
For my days consume away like smoke,
My heart is smitten like grass, and withered;
By reason of the voice of my groaning
I am like a pelican of the wilderness;
I watch, and am become like a sparrow
Mine enemies reproach me all the day;
For I have eaten ashes like bread,
Because of thine indignation and thy wrath:
My days are like a shadow that declineth;
But thou, O Jehovah, wilt abide for ever;
Thou wilt arise, and have mercy upon Zion;
For thy servants take pleasure in her stones,
So the nations shall fear the name of Jehovah,
For Jehovah hath built up Zion;
He hath regarded the prayer of the destitute,
This shall be written for the generation to come;
For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary;
To hear the sighing of the prisoner;
That men may declare the name of Jehovah in Zion,
When the peoples are gathered together,
He weakened my strength in the way;
I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days:
Of old didst thou lay the foundation of the earth;
They shall perish, but thou shalt endure;
But thou art the same,
The children of thy servants shall continue,
Bless Jehovah, O my soul;
Bless Jehovah, O my soul,
Who forgiveth all thine iniquities;
Who redeemeth thy life from destruction;
Who satisfieth thy desire with good things,
Jehovah executeth righteous acts,
He made known his ways unto Moses,
Jehovah is merciful and gracious,
He will not always chide;
He hath not dealt with us after our sins,
For as the heavens are high above the earth,
As far as the east is from the west,
Like as a father pitieth his children,
For he knoweth our frame;
As for man, his days are as grass;
For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone;
But the lovingkindness of Jehovah is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him,
To such as keep his covenant,
Jehovah hath established his throne in the heavens;
Bless Jehovah, ye his angels,
Bless Jehovah, all ye his hosts,
Bless Jehovah, all ye his works,
Bless Jehovah, O my soul.
Who coverest thyself with light as with a garment;
Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters;
Who maketh winds his messengers;
Who laid the foundations of the earth,
Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a vesture;
At thy rebuke they fled;
(The mountains rose, the valleys sank down)
Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over;
He sendeth forth springs into the valleys;
They give drink to every beast of the field;
By them the birds of the heavens have their habitation;
He watereth the mountains from his chambers:
He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle,
And wine that maketh glad the heart of man,
The trees of Jehovah are filled with moisture,
Where the birds make their nests:
The high mountains are for the wild goats;
He appointed the moon for seasons:
Thou makest darkness, and it is night,
The young lions roar after their prey,
The sun ariseth, they get them away,
Man goeth forth unto his work
O Jehovah, how manifold are thy works!
Yonder is the sea, great and wide,
There go the ships;
These wait all for thee,
Thou givest unto them, they gather;
Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled;
Thou sendest forth thy Spirit, they are created;
Let the glory of Jehovah endure for ever;
Who looketh on the earth, and it trembleth;
I will sing unto Jehovah as long as I live:
Let my meditation be sweet unto him:
Let sinners be consumed out of the earth.
Oh give thanks unto Jehovah, call upon his name;
Sing unto him, sing praises unto him;
Glory ye in his holy name:
Seek ye Jehovah and his strength;
Remember his marvellous works that he hath done,
O ye seed of Abraham his servant,
He is Jehovah our God:
He hath remembered his covenant for ever,
The covenant which he made with Abraham,
And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a statute,
Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan,
When they were but a few men in number,
And they went about from nation to nation,
He suffered no man to do them wrong;
Saying, Touch not mine anointed ones,
And he called for a famine upon the land;
He sent a man before them;
His feet they hurt with fetters:
Until the time that his word came to pass,
The king sent and loosed him;
He made him lord of his house,
To bind his princes at his pleasure,
Israel also came into Egypt;
And he increased his people greatly,
He turned their heart to hate his people,
He sent Moses his servant,
They set among them his signs,
He sent darkness, and made it dark;
He turned their waters into blood,
Their land swarmed with frogs
He spake, and there came swarms of flies,
He gave them hail for rain,
He smote their vines also and their fig-trees,
He spake, and the locust came,
And did eat up every herb in their land,
He smote also all the first-born in their land,
And he brought them forth with silver and gold;
Egypt was glad when they departed;
He spread a cloud for a covering,
They asked, and he brought quails,
He opened the rock, and waters gushed out;
For he remembered his holy word,
And he brought forth his people with joy,
And he gave them the lands of the nations;
That they might keep his statutes,
Praise ye Jehovah.
Who can utter the mighty acts of Jehovah,
Blessed are they that keep justice,
Remember me, O Jehovah, with the favor that thou bearest unto thy people;
That I may see the prosperity of thy chosen,
We have sinned with our fathers,
Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt;
Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake,
He rebuked the Red Sea also, and it was dried up:
And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them,
And the waters covered their adversaries;
Then believed they his words;
They soon forgat his works;
But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness,
And he gave them their request,
They envied Moses also in the camp,
The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan,
And a fire was kindled in their company;
They made a calf in Horeb,
Thus they changed their glory
They forgat God their Saviour,
Wondrous works in the land of Ham,
Therefore he said that he would destroy them,
Yea, they despised the pleasant land,
But murmured in their tents,
Therefore he sware unto them,
And that he would overthrow their seed among the nations,
They joined themselves also unto Baal-peor,
Thus they provoked him to anger with their doings;
Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment;
And that was reckoned unto him for righteousness,
They angered him also at the waters of Meribah,
Because they were rebellious against his spirit,
They did not destroy the peoples,
But mingled themselves with the nations,
And served their idols,
Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto demons,
And shed innocent blood,
Thus were they defiled with their works,
Therefore was the wrath of Jehovah kindled against his people,
And he gave them into the hand of the nations;
Their enemies also oppressed them,
Many times did he deliver them;
Nevertheless he regarded their distress,
And he remembered for them his covenant,
He made them also to be pitied
Save us, O Jehovah our God,
Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel,
O give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good;
Let the redeemed of Jehovah say so,
And gathered out of the lands,
They wandered in the wilderness in a desert way;
Hungry and thirsty,
Then they cried unto Jehovah in their trouble,
He led them also by a straight way,
Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,
For he satisfieth the longing soul,
Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death,
Because they rebelled against the words of God,
Therefore he brought down their heart with labor;
Then they cried unto Jehovah in their trouble,
He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death,
Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,
For he hath broken the gates of brass,
Fools because of their transgression,
Their soul abhorreth all manner of food;
Then they cry unto Jehovah in their trouble,
He sendeth his word, and healeth them,
Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,
And let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving,
They that go down to the sea in ships,
These see the works of Jehovah,
For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind,
They mount up to the heavens, they go down again to the depths:
They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man,
Then they cry unto Jehovah in their trouble,
He maketh the storm a calm,
Then are they glad because they are quiet;
Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,
Let them exalt him also in the assembly of the people,
He turneth rivers into a wilderness,
A fruitful land into a salt desert,
He turneth a wilderness into a pool of water,
And there he maketh the hungry to dwell,
And sow fields, and plant vineyards,
He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly;
Again, they are diminished and bowed down
He poureth contempt upon princes,
Yet setteth he the needy on high from affliction,
The upright shall see it, and be glad;
Whoso is wise will give heed to these things;
My heart is fixed, O God;
Awake, psaltery and harp:
I will give thanks unto thee, O Jehovah, among the peoples;
For thy lovingkindness is great above the heavens;
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens,
That thy beloved may be delivered,
God hath spoken in his holiness: I will exult;
Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine;
Moab is my washpot;
Who will bring me into the fortified city?
Hast not thou cast us off, O God?
Give us help against the adversary;
Through God we shall do valiantly:
Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;
For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of deceit have they opened against me:
They have compassed me about also with words of hatred,
For my love they are my adversaries:
And they have rewarded me evil for good,
Set thou a wicked man over him;
When he is judged, let him come forth guilty;
Let his days be few;
Let his children be fatherless,
Let his children be vagabonds, and beg;
Let the extortioner catch all that he hath;
Let there be none to extend kindness unto him;
Let his posterity be cut off;
Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with Jehovah;
Let them be before Jehovah continually,
Because he remembered not to show kindness,
Yea, he loved cursing, and it came unto him;
He clothed himself also with cursing as with his garment,
Let it be unto him as the raiment wherewith he covereth himself,
This is the reward of mine adversaries from Jehovah,
But deal thou with me, O Jehovah the Lord, for thy name’s sake:
For I am poor and needy,
I am gone like the shadow when it declineth:
My knees are weak through fasting;
I am become also a reproach unto them:
Help me, O Jehovah my God;
That they may know that this is thy hand;
Let them curse, but bless thou:
Let mine adversaries be clothed with dishonor,
I will give great thanks unto Jehovah with my mouth;
For he will stand at the right hand of the needy,
Jehovah saith unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand,
Jehovah will send forth the rod of thy strength out of Zion:
Thy people offer themselves willingly
Jehovah hath sworn, and will not repent:
The Lord at thy right hand
He will judge among the nations,
He will drink of the brook in the way:
Praise ye Jehovah.
The works of Jehovah are great,
His work is honor and majesty;
He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered:
He hath given food unto them that fear him:
He hath showed his people the power of his works,
The works of his hands are truth and justice;
They are established for ever and ever;
He hath sent redemption unto his people;
The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of wisdom;
Praise ye Jehovah.
His seed shall be mighty upon earth:
Wealth and riches are in his house;
Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness:
Well is it with the man that dealeth graciously and lendeth;
For he shall never be moved;
He shall not be afraid of evil tidings:
His heart is established, he shall not be afraid,
